detaileddescription.para: Calls DocumentVisitor.VisitFormField.
For more info see the Visitor design pattern.

briefdescription.para: True if references to the specified form field are automatically updated whenever the field is exited.

detaileddescription.para: Setting CalculateOnExit only affects the behavior of the form field when the document is opened in Microsoft Word. Aspose.Words never updates references to the form field.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the size of the checkbox in points. Has effect only when IsCheckBoxExactSize is true.

detaileddescription.para: Applicable for a check box form field only.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the checked status of the check box form field. Default value for this property is false.

detaileddescription.para: Applicable for a check box form field only.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the default value of the check box form field. Default value for this property is false.

detaileddescription.para: Applicable for a check box form field only.

briefdescription.para: Provides access to the items of a dropdown form field.

detaileddescription.para: Microsoft Word allows maximum 25 items in a dropdown form field.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the index specifying the currently selected item in a dropdown form field.
True if a form field is enabled.

detaileddescription.para: If a form field is enabled, its contents can be changed as the form is filled in.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets an entry macro name for the form field.

detaileddescription.para: The entry macro runs when the form field gets the focus in Microsoft Word.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 32 characters.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets an exit macro name for the form field.

detaileddescription.para: The exit macro runs when the form field loses the focus in Microsoft Word.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 32 characters.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the text that's displayed in a message box when the form field has the focus and the user presses F1.

detaileddescription.para: If the OwnHelp property is set to True, HelpText specifies the text string value. If OwnHelp is set to False, HelpText specifies the name of an AutoText entry that contains help text for the form field.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 255 characters.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the boolean value that indicates whether the size of the textbox is automatic or specified explicitly.

detaileddescription.para: Applicable for a check box form field only.

briefdescription.para: Maximum length for the text field. Zero when the length is not limited.
Gets or sets the form field name.
Specifies the source of the text that's displayed in a message box when a form field has the focus and the user presses F1.

detaileddescription.para: If True, the text specified by the HelpText property is displayed. If False, the text in the AutoText entry specified by the HelpText property is displayed.

briefdescription.para: Specifies the source of the text that's displayed in the status bar when a form field has the focus.

detaileddescription.para: If true, the text specified by the StatusText property is displayed. If false, the text of the AutoText entry specified by the StatusText property is displayed.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets a string that represents the result of this form field.

detaileddescription.para: For a text form field the result is the text that is in the field.
For a checkbox form field the result can be "1" or "0" to indicate checked or unchecked.
For a dropdown form field the result is the string selected in the dropdown.
Setting Result for a text form field does not apply the text format specified in TextInputFormat. If you want to set a value and apply the format, use the SetTextInputValue() method.
For a text form field the TextInputDefault value is applied if value is null.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the text that's displayed in the status bar when a form field has the focus.

detaileddescription.para: If the OwnStatus property is set to true, the StatusText property specifies the status bar text. If the OwnStatus property is set to false, the StatusText property specifies the name of an AutoText entry that contains status bar text for the form field.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 138 characters.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the default string or a calculation expression of a text form field.

detaileddescription.para: The meaning of this property depends on the value of the TextInputType property.

When TextInputType is Regular or Number, this string specifies the default string for the text form field. This string is the content that Microsoft Word will display in the document when the form field is empty.

When TextInputType is Calculated, then this string holds the expression to be calculated. The expression needs to be a formula valid according to Microsoft Word formula field requirements. When you set a new expression using this property, Aspose.Words calculates the formula result automatically and inserts it into the form field.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 255 characters.

briefdescription.para: Returns or sets the text formatting for a text form field.

detaileddescription.para: If the text form field contains regular text, then valid format strings are "", "UPPERCASE", "LOWERCASE", "FIRST CAPITAL" and "TITLE CASE". The strings are case-insensitive.
If the text form field contains a number or a date/time value, then valid format strings are number or date and time format strings.
Microsoft Word allows strings with at most 64 characters.

briefdescription.para: Gets or sets the type of a text form field.
Removes the complete form field, not just the form field special character.
Applies the text format specified in TextInputFormat and stores the value in Result.

detaileddescription.para: Microsoft Word provides the following form fields: checkbox, text input and dropdown (combobox).
FormField is an inline-node and can only be a child of Paragraph.
FormField is represented in a document by a special character and positioned as a character within a line of text.

A complete form field in a Word document is a complex structure represented by several nodes: field start, field code such as FORMTEXT, form field data, field separator, field result, field end and a bookmark. To programmatically create form fields in a Word document use DocumentBuilder.InsertCheckBox, DocumentBuilder.InsertTextInput and DocumentBuilder.InsertComboBox which make sure all of the form field nodes are created in a correct order and in a suitable state.
